Class APNGCollector

java.lang.Object
com.librian.lib.APNGCollector
public class APNGCollector extends Object
A class to create an animated PNG.

  • Constructor Details

    • APNGCollector

      public APNGCollector(BufferedImage sImg, int plays) throws IOException
      Constructs an instance of an object that creates an APNG in which a static image is NOT part of the animation.
      Parameters:
      sImg - a static image that displays in a non-animated PNG decoder.
      plays - a number of times that this animation should play. If it is 0, the animation should play indefinitely.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during writing.

    • APNGCollector

      public APNGCollector(BufferedImage sImg, int plays, short numerator, short denominator, byte dispose, byte blend) throws IOException
      Constructs an instance of an object that creates an APNG in which a static image is part of the animation.
      Parameters:
      sImg - a static image that displays in a non-animated PNG decoder.
      plays - a number of times that this animation should play. If it is 0, the animation should play indefinitely.
      numerator - define the numerator of the delay fraction
      denominator - define the denominator of the delay fraction.
      dispose - defines the type of frame area disposal to be done after rendering this frame. 
        APNG_DISPOSE_OP_NONE
    no disposal is done on this frame before rendering the next; the contents of the output buffer are left as is.

  APNG_DISPOSE_OP_BACKGROUND
    the frame's region of the output buffer is to be cleared to fully transparent black before rendering the next frame.

  APNG_DISPOSE_OP_PREVIOUS
    the frame's region of the output buffer is to be reverted to the previous contents before rendering the next frame.
      blend - specifies whether the frame is to be alpha blended into the current output buffer content, or whether it should completely replace its region in the output buffer. 
        APNG_BLEND_OP_SOURCE
    all color components of the frame, including alpha, overwrite the current contents of the frame's output buffer region.

  APNG_BLEND_OP_OVER
    the frame should be composited onto the output buffer based on its alpha.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during writing or reading a static image.

  • Method Details

    • addFrame

      public void addFrame(BufferedImage frame, int x, int y, short numerator, short denominator, byte dispose, byte blend) throws IOException
      Add frame in animation.
      Parameters:
      frame - animation frame.
      x - define the x position of the following frame.
      y - define the y position of the following frame.
      numerator - define the denominator of the delay fraction.
      denominator - defines the type of frame area disposal to be done after rendering this frame.
      dispose - defines the type of frame area disposal to be done after rendering this frame. 
        APNG_DISPOSE_OP_NONE
    no disposal is done on this frame before rendering the next; the contents of the output buffer are left as is.

  APNG_DISPOSE_OP_BACKGROUND
    the frame's region of the output buffer is to be cleared to fully transparent black before rendering the next frame.

  APNG_DISPOSE_OP_PREVIOUS
    the frame's region of the output buffer is to be reverted to the previous contents before rendering the next frame.
      blend - specifies whether the frame is to be alpha blended into the current output buffer content, or whether it should completely replace its region in the output buffer. 
        APNG_BLEND_OP_SOURCE
    all color components of the frame, including alpha, overwrite the current contents of the frame's output buffer region.

  APNG_BLEND_OP_OVER
    the frame should be composited onto the output buffer based on its alpha.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during writing or reading a frame.

    • build

      public byte[] build() throws IOException
      Returns:
      APNG stream in byte array.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during writing.

    • createPNGStream

      private ByteArrayInputStream createPNGStream(BufferedImage frame) throws IOException
      Writes the BufferedImage to the byte array stream as a PNG, simplifies PNG stream.
